p.i: An Optional Class or Death Alternative for 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons.

description.p: Mortality. All who draw breath fear the icy grip of death, the promised end. It is the primal fear that drives much of history, and the promise of a restful afterlife brings weight to the influence of any temple.

Your afterlife, unfortunately, is not so restful. You’ve been cut down, left to die, and your spirit now remains, unable to pass on when so filled with fear, with anger, with questions. Binding to whatever symbol will anchor you to the world of the living, you feel the hunger for answers rival your need for vengeance as you learn to control this ethereal existence thrust upon you.

With the aid of still-living allies, you continue the pursuit of your goals using your spectral gifts to frighten, manipulate, and control those who would stand in your way. Leaping from body to body, wrestling control from your foes as you send them to a worser fate than yours, you continue to fight for another chance at life... or embrace your ghostly talents to do what living mortals cannot, ever fighting the cold and hungry urges that encompass the curse of undeath.

p.i: This is a complicated class the DM can offer as a choice upon character creation, or offered by the DM when a player character death is surrounded by enough violence or mystery to cause the soul to cling to the mortal world. It can allow the continued play of a beloved character when resurrection is unavailable, or as a reward for a party seeking to restore the narrative lost when a central figure has fallen. Players should not be able to select to become a Lingering Soul upon death; it should be offered with good reason, and it should be an option granted sparingly.

setters.set: This class does not support multiclassing.

description.p: As you step into the world of wandering spirits, be mindful of the circumstances that led to your demise. Fear or anger may forever be ingrained within you regarding related places or people. Vengeance drives those souls who met an unjust end at the hand of others, and your will may push you towards avenging what undue death found you. Others may remain to protect their friends as they reach a goal, leaving you to guide them along a hope you fell pursuing. What ideals keep your soul in the world of the living?

This can be a challenging class, both for the player, and the Dungeon Master. Being a Lingering Soul bestows the player with a number of very useful utility features, survival techniques, and a very unique way of addressing most any combat encounter. It also can allow the continued play of a fallen character while magic to restore them is currently unavailable. However, many of these abilities can lead to dangerous circumstances if care is not taken. They also suffer from lower hit points, a general lack of armor, and the threat of looming permanent death.
As a note, Lingering Souls are unable to multiclass.

You can make a lingering soul quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Strength or Dexterity your highest ability score if you plan to develop into a Poltergeist. Alternatively, you could make Dexterityor Intelligence your highest ability score if you want to become a Wraith, or if becoming a Spiritual Guardian is your style, select Wisdom or Charisma. Next, invest in a higher Constitution, as healing and survival can prove tricky. Then select the background that befits your life before death.
As a lingering soul, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d6 per lingering soul level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 6 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d6 (or 4) + your Constitution modifier per lingering soul level after 1st
Skills: Choose three from History, Investigation, Insight, Intimidation, Perception, Religion, Sleight of Hand, or Stealth.

description.p: You start with the following equipment your body would have on it, in addition to the equipment granted by your background, though carrying this equipment may prove difficult without aid.

ul.li: (a) a dungeoneer’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack
a trinket (rolled on the Trinkets table, PHB pg. 160)

description.p: If a decceased player character returns as a Lingering Soul, they lose all previous class levels and abilities, instead returning with a number of levels in Lingering Soul equal ore less than their previous character level. They retain any languages they knew in life, as well as racial benefits and abilities, but loose all previous skill proficiencies, saving throw proficiencies, feats, and Ability Score improvements gained via class levels.

tr.td: Spirit Binding, Phantom Calling, Ghostly Form

setters.set: You’ve been cut down, left to die, and your spirit now remains, unable to pass on.

description.p: You Starting at 1st level, you must select an object or creature of your choice (it could be an heirloom, weapon, or ally) to bind to indefinetely. You must remain within 150 feet of your bound target at all times, and if the object or creature leaves your 150 foot radius, you are dragged along with it. You are always aware of where your bound object or creature is in relation to you.

Sould the object be destroyed, or the creature slain, you immediately drop to 0 hit points. If you regain conscioussness without a spirit bond, you must immediately select a new object or creature within 150 feet to bind to. If nothing is present to bind to, you are paralyzed until an object or creature somes within 150 feet of you to bind to.

sheet.description: You bind yourself to an object or creature and you must remain within 150 feet of it. You are always aware of where your bound object or creature is in relation to you, and if it leaves your 150 foot radius, you are dragged along with it.

description.p: Beginning at 1st level, you select a Phantom Calling that defines the path of your spiritual journey. Choose Poltergeist, Wraith, or Spirit Guardian. The calling you choose grants you features at 1st level and again at 6th, 11th, and 15th level.

The Phantom Calling you select will define one of your Ability Scores to carry over from life as the characteristic that now defines you in undeath, called your Aspect. The ability modifier from this ability score also acts as your Aspect modifier in regards to Lingering Soul features.

Some of your Lingering Soul features require you to make an Aspect attack, or your target to make a saving throw to resist a feature’s effects. The modifier and saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

center.p: Lingering Soul save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Aspect modifier
Aspect attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Aspect modifier

description.p: At 1st level, your physical body is no more, your new, spectral form existing in the space between realms. You gain the following benefits:
Your creature type is Undead, and you are considered undead in respect to all spells, abilities, and effects.
You give off a cold glow equal to dim light for a 5 foot radius.
You cannot physically carry any objects or wear equipment. You also no longer need to eat or drink, nor gain the benefits of any objects or substances that require ingestion.
While you are not possessing a creature, you have resistance against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.
You are also immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition.
You are immune to the prone, grappled, restrained, and petrified conditions.
You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take 1d10 force damage if you end your turn inside an object.
You fall at a rate of 60 feet per round, and do not suffer falling damage.
You still take short or long rests per usual to use hit dice and regain the use of abilities, but do not require sleep.

Should you fall to 0 hit points, you begin fading. You are considered unconscious, and make death saving throws as normal. Should you fail three death saving throws, your spirit withers away into the ether. Your soul is cast into the vaults of the underworld and cannot be recovered or resurrected outside the use of a Wish spell.

Should you ever be brought back to life via a spell or resurrection effect, you immediately lose all levels in Lingering Soul and return to life as your previous, living self. You gain back class levels in your original classes as they were upon death, plus one additional character level per level of Lingering Soul gained while playing as a spirit.

sheet.description: Your creature type is Undead and do not require sleep. You give off dim light in a 5 foot radius. You cannot physically carry any objects or wear equipment and no longer need to eat or drink. While not possessing a creature, you have resistance against nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. You are immune to poison damage, and the poisoned, prone, grappled, restrained, and petrified conditions. You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, taking 1d10 force damage if you end your turn inside an object. You do not suffer falling damage. Should you fall to 0 hit points, you begin fading, are considered unconscious, and make death saving throws as normal. Should you fail three death saving throws, your soul cannot be recovered or resurrected outside the use of a Wish spell. Should you ever be brought back to life via a spell or resurrection effect, return to life as your previous, living self.

Your creature type is Undead and do not require sleep. You give off dim light in a 5 foot radius. You cannot physically carry any objects or wear equipment and no longer need to eat or drink. While not possessing a creature, you have resistance against nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. You are immune to poison damage, and the poisoned, prone, grappled, restrained, and petrified conditions. You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, taking 1d10 force damage if you end your turn inside an object. You do not suffer falling damage. Should you fall to 0 hit points, you begin fading, are considered unconscious, and make death saving throws as normal. Should you ever be brought back to life via a spell or resurrection effect, return to life as your previous, living self.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you discover the ability to enter the bodies of other creatures and influence their actions. As a bonus action, you can attempt to possess one creature within 5 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become possessed. A creature can fail this saving throw voluntarily.

While possessing a creature, your body occupies the same space as the host and is not visible. You cannot be targeted or affected by any sttacks or spells, but you suffer damage equal to half of any damage dealt to the host while possessed. If the host moves, you move with them. You can only experience what the host sees and hears, and can communicate with them telepathically. You can only use features that specify their use while possessing a host.

A possessed creature acts as normal on its turn. However, you can use your action to force the possessed creature to make an immediate weapon attack against a target of your choice within range, adding your Aspect modifier to the damage dealt. You can instead use your action to force the possessed creature to Dash in a direction of your choice, or take the Dodge action.

This possession lasts until the host drops to 0 hit points, you drop to 0 hit points, or you are forced out by an effect like Dispell Evil and Good spell or Turn Undead ability. You then reappear in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the creature. You can choose to end the possession for free at the start of your turn. The host creature is immune to your possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the possession saving throw or after the possession ends (unless the creature wishes otherwise).

sheet.description: As a bonus action, you can force one creature within 5 feet to succeed on a DC {{lingering-soul-aspect-dc}} Charisma saving throw or become possessed (can be failed voluntarily). • You cannot be targeted or affected by any sttacks or spells, but you suffer damage equal to half of any damage dealt to the possessed host. You can only experience what the host sees and hears, and can communicate with them telepathically. • A possessed creature acts as normal on its turn. However, you can use your action to force the possessed creature to make an immediate weapon attack against a target of your choice within range, adding +{{lingering-soul-aspect-mod}} to the damage dealt. You can also use your action to force the possessed creature to Dash in a direction of your choice, or take the Dodge action. • The possession lasts until the host or you drop to 0 hit points, or you are forced out by an effect. You can choose to end the possession at the start of your turn. The host creature is immune to your possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the possession saving throw or after the possession ends (unless the creature wishes otherwise).

description.p: At 3rd level, you have learned how to absorb powerful arcane enchantments from potent items. You can spend an hour syphoning the mystic properties of a magic item. When the hour ritual is complete, the enchantment (and any attunement) becomes indefinetely bound to your ghostly form, leaving the item inert. You have a limit of five enchantments that can be bound to you in this way, of which three can be enchantments that require attunement (the process attunes it to you). To consume a new enchantment beyond five, you must permanently discard an existing enchantment you harbor.

A weapon enchantment you have consumed can be applied to any physical or weapon attack you make. If you are possessing a host, you can apply one of your consumed weapon enchantments to any attacks you force them to make with a nonmagical weapon.
Some items and artifacts cannot be consumed in this way (DM’s discression).

sheet.description: You can spend one hour to absorb an enchantment from a magic item. You can have up to five enchantments bound to you in this way, of which three can require attunement (the process attunes it to you). A consumed weapon enchantment can be applied to any physical or weapon attack you make, or to any attacks with a nonmagical weapon you force your host to make.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

At 5th level, you have become more adept enough at possession to utilize the shell of a slain creature as a vessel. Your Possession ability can now target the dead body of a creature within 5 feet of you, and the corpse automatically fails their saving throw. This possession ends after 1 minute. The host corpse is considered to have 1 hit point and starts prone. You can use your movement to move the host corpse at your speed. If a host corpse is reduced to 0 hit points, or the possession ends, it is destroyed and cannot be possessed again.

sheet.description: Your can now posses dead creatures within 5 feet of you, for 1 minute. The host corpse has 1 hit point, uses your speed and starts prone. If it is reduced to 0 hit points, or the possession ends, it is destroyed and cannot be possessed again.

description.p: At 5th level, you have become more adept at controlling and manipulating the bodies of your host. If a creature is unaware of your presence, you can attempt to possess them without them knowing. Make a Dexterity (Stealth) check contested by the target’s Wisdom (Perception) check. If you win, and they fail their saving throw, you successfully possess them without their knowledge.
Whenever you force the host to do anything, they can make a Wisdom (Insight) check against your Lingering Soul DC. On as success, they become aware of the possession.

sheet.description: You can attempt to stealthily possess a creature that is unaware of your presence. If you win a Dexterity (Stealth) check contested by the target’s Wisdom (Perception) check, and they fail their saving throw, you successfully possess them without their knowledge. Whenever you force the host to do anything, they can make a DC {{lingering-soul-aspect-dc}} Wisdom (Insight) check in order to become aware of the possession.

description.p: Beginning at 7th level, you can temporarily become incorporeal to avoid the brunt of an attack against you. When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack’s damage against you.
When you would receive half of the damage a possessed creature suffers from an attack, you can use your reaction to reduce it to a quarter of the damage suffered.

sheet.description: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack’s damage against you. When you would receive half of the damage your possessed host suffers, you can use your reaction to reduce it to a quarter of the damage suffered.

description.p: Starting at 9th level, you can use an action while possessing a host to manipulate their speech and force them to say or yell a short phrase of twenty-five words or less. Any Charisma ability checks initiated this way uses your Charisma ability score and skills in place of the host’s.

If the host begins casting a spell that uses verbal components, you can use your reaction to try to force them to fumble the incantation. The host must make a Constitution saving throw against you Lingering Soul DC. On a failure, the spell fails, the spell slot is expended, and the possession immediately ends.

sheet.description: You can use an action while possessing a host to force them to say or yell up to twenty-five words or less, using your Charisma ability score and skills. If the host begins casting a spell using verbal components, you can use your reaction to force them to make a DC {{lingering-soul-aspect-dc}} Constitution saving. On a failure, the spell fails, the spell slot is expended, and the possession immediately ends.

description.p: Upon reaching 10th level, you have further expanded the capabilities of your ghostly body. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You gain a fly speed equal to your speed.
You can cast Invisibility on yourself, without requiring material components, twice per day.

sheet.description: You gain a fly speed equal to your speed. You can cast Invisibility on yourself, without requiring material components, twice per day.

description.p: At 13th level, you have learned to expand your ghostly chill to temporarily freeze your host’s vitals. When a possessed host makes an attack, you can use your reaction to give the triggering attack disadvantage.

sheet.description: When a possessed host makes an attack, you can use your reaction to give the triggering attack disadvantage.

description.p: Beginning at 14th level, you can twist your appearance into a terrifying vision of undeath. As an action, choose any number of creatures within 30 feet of you. If they can see you, they must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn. On subsequent turns, you can use your action to extend the duration of this effect on the frightened creatures until the end of you next turn. This effect ends if a creature ends its turn out of line of sight of you.
If a creature succeeds on its saving throw, you cannot use this feature on that creature again for 24 hours.
You must finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

sheet.description: Choose any number of creatures within 30 feet of you, that can see you, and force them to succeed on a DC {{lingering-soul-aspect-dc}} Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn. You can use your action on subsequent turns, to extend this effect on the frightened creatures until the end of you next turn. This effect ends if a creature ends its turn out of sight of you. A creature succeeding on its saving throw, cannot be affected again for 24 hours.

description.p: Upon reaching 17th level, your spirit has evolved to become tethered to this plane, nevertruly destroyed by unhallowed weapons. You are no longer bound to an Object or creature, as per your Spirit Binding feature, and may wander as you please.

Whenever you would be destroyed by failing a third death saving throw, you instead vanish for 24 hours, slumbering on the Ethereal Plane. You then return at the spot where you fell, rested as if you completed a long rest. You suffer a -4 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks. Every time you finish a subsequent long rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it disappears.
If the area where your spirit was struck down is under the effect of a Hallow spell when you return, your spirit is instead scattered and lost forever in the Ethereal Plane.

sheet.description: You are no longer bound to an Object or creature. When you fail a third death saving throw, you vanish for 24 hours, and then return at the spot where you fell, rested as if you completed a long rest. You suffer a -4 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks (reduced by 1 each subsequent long rest). If the area is under the effect of a Hallow spell when you return, your spirit is instead lost forever.

description.p: At 18th level, you have gained the ability to completely control a host. While possessing a living host, you can use your action to take total and precise control of the target. Until the end of your next turn, the creature takes only the actions you choose, and doesn’t do anything that you don’t allow it to do. During this time, you can also cause the creature to use its reaction, but this requires you to use xour own reaction as well.
Each time the host takes damage during a turn where you are controlling it this way, it makes a new Charisma saving throw against your possession. If the saving throw succeeds, the possession ends.

sheet.description: You can use your action to take total control of your possessed host until the end of your next turn. You can also use your reaction to cause the host to use its reaction. While controlling your host in this way, each time it takes damage, it makes a new saving throw against your possession.

description.p: When you reach 20th level, you can try to sunder the spirit of a host from its body. While possessing a host that is neither undead or a construct, you can use your action to end your possession and force to make a Constitution saving throw. It takes 12d10 necrotic damage on a failure, and half as much damage on a success. If the creature is brought to under 50 hit points by this damage, it dies.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: You end the possession of a host that is neither undead or a construct, and force them to make a DC {{lingering-soul-aspect-dc}} Constitution saving throw, taking 12d10 necrotic damage on a failure and half as much on a success. If this damage reduces the target to less than 50 hit points, it dies.

description.p: Those souls who wish to still exert their will on the physical world, shifting steel and flesh with their anger alone, begin walking the way of the Poltergeist. Abandoning subtlety to instead harness a maelstrom of unbridled emotion, the Poltergeist exhibits the ability to lift, shift, push, and manipulate the substancial realm around them. The clattering of dangerous weapons and helpless attackers being invisibly flung through the air mercilessly marks the fury of these ferocious shades.

Upon becoming a Poltergeist, choose either your Strength, Dexterity or Intelligence to become your Aspect. Your Aspect modifier is equal to that of the chosen Ability Score. You gain proficiency in Strength saving throws.
Upon choosing to become a Poltergeist at 1st level, you gain proficiency with 3 melee weapons of your choice.
You may choose 2 additional melee weapons to gain proficiency with at 6th level, 11th level, and 15th level.
Beginning at 1st level, you are able to focus on small objects and move them with alarming speed using your phantom strength. You learn the Mage Hand cantrip.

As an action, you can choose an object that weighs no more than 10 pounds within 30 feet of you. You mystically hurl it 30 feet in any direction. If you choose to have the object strike a creature, roll a ranged Aspect attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 + your Aspect modifier bludgeoning damage, and the object drops to the ground. If the object is a weapon you are proficient in, use the weapons damage dice and type instead. Any magical weapons you are proficient with and attuned to can be used with this feature.

If the target object is currently being held by another creature, they must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature drops the object you choose and you may move it 15 feet with this feature.

Upon reaching 6th level, you can target and move two objects when you take the Haunt action instead of one. Alternatively, you can move a single object twice in rapid succession, allowing two attacks with a single weapon or object.

sheet.description: You mystically hurl an object (less than 10 pounds within 30 feet of you) 30 feet in any direction. If you choose to strike a creature, roll a ranged Aspect attack (+{{lingering-soul-aspect-attack}} to hit) against that creature. On a hit, the target takes 1d4+{{lingering-soul-aspect-mod}} bludgeoning damage, and the object drops to the ground. If the object is a weapon you are proficient in, use its damage dice and type instead. If the target object is held by another creature, they must succeed on a DC {{lingering-soul-aspect-dc}} Strength saving throw, or drop the object, allowing you to move it 15 feet.

You mystically hurl up to two objects, or one object twice (less than 10 pounds within 30 feet of you) 30 feet in any direction. If you choose to strike a creature, roll a ranged Aspect attack (+{{lingering-soul-aspect-attack}} to hit) against that creature. On a hit, the target takes 1d4+{{lingering-soul-aspect-mod}} bludgeoning damage, and the object drops to the ground. If the object is a weapon you are proficient in, use its damage dice and type instead. If the target object is held by another creature, they must succeed on a DC {{lingering-soul-aspect-dc}} Strength saving throw, or drop the object, allowing you to move it 15 feet.

description.p: When you reach 6th level, you can will nearby gear to surround your spectral body. As a bonus action, select any pieces of wearable equipment within 30 feet that aren’t currently being worn by a creature. The equipment is drawn into the air and assembles around, bestowing you with any Armor Class bonuses, benefits, and detriments granted by wearing the equipment. You need not be proficient with any armor to wear it in this way, and you ignore the Strength requirement of heavy armor. Any magical equipment you are attuned to can be used with this feature. You are still limited by equipment slots (one helmet, one set of boots, etc).

This equipment remains assembled around you until you choose to drop it, you attempt to possess a creature, you pass through a solid creature or object, or until you take a short or long rest. Equipment dropped is immediatelyleft on the ground in your space.

sheet.description: As a bonus action, equipment of your choice within 30 feet not currently being worn assembles around you. You can "wear" this equipment as if you were corporeal, but you require no armor proficiency, and you ignore the Strength requirement of heavy armor. This equipment remains assembled around you until you choose to drop it, you attempt to possess a creature, you pass through a solid creature or object, or until you take a short or long rest.

description.p: Upon reaching 11th level, you can exert your ghostly will to manipulate living creatures from a distance. As an action, you can choose a creature that is large or smaller within 30 feet of you. The target must make a Strength saving throw or be hurled 30 feet in any direction, including upward. If the target comes in contact with a hard surface, creature, or heavy object, the target takes 1d8 bludgeoning damage per 10 feet moved and is knocked prone.

If the target creature is hurled into a second creature within range, the second creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. The second creature also takes 1d8 bludgeoning damage per 10 feet moved and is knocked prone on a failed save, or half as much damage and is no knocked prone on a successful one.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Aspect modifier (minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can force a creature (large or smaller within 30 feet) to succeed on a DC {{lingering-soul-aspect-dc}} Strength saving throw or be hurled 30 feet taking 1d8 bludgeoning damage per 10 feet moved and is knocked prone. If the target hits a second creature, that creature must make a DC {{lingering-soul-aspect-dc}} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the second creature takes the same damage and is also knocked prone, or half as much damage and is no knocked prone on a successful one.

description.p: Once you reach 15th level, you have learned to unleash your spectral anger. As an action, you begin calling surrounding debris to spiral and orbit you at incredible speeds. Whenever an enemy creature comes within 30 feet of you for the first time on a turn, or starts its turn within 30 feet of you, it immediately suffers 1d6 slashing damage, 1d6 piercing damage, and 1d6 bludgeoning damage. This feature lasts for up to 1 minute.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again

sheet.description: For up to 1 minute, whenever an enemy creature comes within 30 feet of you for the first time on a turn, or starts its turn within 30 feet of you, it immediately suffers 1d6 slashing damage, 1d6 piercing damage, and 1d6 bludgeoning damage.

description.p: The Wraith is a dangerous path for any soul to take, and few have a choice should their life been entwined with dubious arcane pursuits or necromantic corruption. Those who who take the path of the wraith embrace the desire for warmth and the hunger for the life they once had. Their energy becomes dark, enshrouded in shadow and malice... but the will remains, and there are tales of those lost souls who could master the craving and focus their hate on those who deserve it.

Upon becoming a Wraith, choose either your Dexterity, Intelligence, or Charisma to become your Aspect. Your Aspect modifier is equal to that of the chosen Ability Score. You gain proficiency in Intelligence saving throws.

Upon following this calling at 1st level, you gain the ability to tear through creatures with ghastly claws, stealing some of their essence. As an action, you can make a melee Aspect attack against a creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes necrotic damage equal to 1d8 + your Aspect modifier. If the target isn’t undead or a construct, you regain hit points equal to half of the damage dealt.
The damage of your Scything Claw increases to 2d8 at 6th level, 3d8 at 11th level, and 4d8 at 15th level.

sheet.description: You can make a melee Aspect attack (+ {{lingering-soul-aspect-attack}} to hit) against a creature within 5 feet. On a hit, the target takes {{lingering-soul-scything-claw-die}}d8+{{lingering-soul-aspect-mod}} necrotic damage. If the target isn’t undead or a construct, you regain hit points equal to half of the damage dealt.

description.p: At 6th level, your spectral body becomes further attuned to the cold, dark world of the undead. Your ghostly form no longer emmits a cold, dim light out in a 5 foot radius. You gain darkvision out to 60 feet, as well as resistance to cold and necrotic damage, but also have disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight while in direct sunlight.
While possessing a host, you can choose to impart them with the benefits of this feature, but in doing so also impart the penalties while in direct sunlight.

sheet.description: You no longer emmit dim light, gain darkvision out to 60 feet, and gain resistance to cold and necrotic damage. While in sunlight, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and Perception checks that rely on sight. While possessing a host, you can choose to impart them with these benefits and penalties.

description.p: Beginning at 11th level, your presence devours nearby light, obscuring your form while syphoning life lost under darkness. Your icy presence extinguishes any natural open flame within 30 feet of you. While in dim light or darkness, you can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Whenever a living creature in dim light or darkness dies within 30 feet of you, you gain temporary hit points equal to 1d8 + your Aspect modifier. This aura remains while possessing a host.
At 15th level, the amount of temporary hit points gained increases to 2d8 + your Aspect modifier.

sheet.description: Your presence extinguishes any natural open flame within 30 feet of you. While in dim light or darkness, you can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Whenever a living creature in dim light or darkness dies within 30 feet of you, you gain {{lingering-soul-aura-of-midnight-die}}d8+{{lingering-soul-aspect-mod}} temporary hit points. This aura remains while possessing a host.

description.p: Upon reaching 15th level, you have learned how to spread the curse of undeath to your fallen foes. As an action, you can target a humanoid corpse within 10 feet that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute, and died violently. The target’s spirit rises as a Specter in the space of the corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space.

The Specter is under your control, allowing you to issue commands to the creature while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of the action, such as "Attack that creature", "Run over there", or "Fetch that object". If the creature completed the order and doesn’t receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself and you to the best of its ability.
You can have no more than a number of Specters equal to your Aspect modifierunder your control at one time.

sheet.description: As an action, you can create a Specter from the spirit of a humanoid corpse within 10 feet that died violently in the last minute. It is under your control, allowing you to issue commands while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. Otherwise it defends itself and you to the best of its ability. You cannot control more than {{lingering-soul-aspect-mod}} Specters at one time.

description.p: Some souls that persist in the mortal realm seek a greater purpose. Whether they remain to see to some divine duty, or wish to entice or corrupt the souls of others in the name of a dark patron, it’s these spirits who invite deific guidance into their fate that begin to resemble the celestial beings or twisted fiends they worship. Relying on physical vessels to channel their fury, these guardians use their gifts to protect, herm, or influence all they encounter.

Upon becoming a Spirit Guardian, choose either your Wisdom or Charisma to become your Aspect. Your Aspect modifier is equal to that of the chosen Ability Score. You gain proficiency in Charisma saving throws.

When you choose this calling at 1st level, you can instill power into the weapons of nearby creatures to strike with divine flame. As an action, target a weapon or object within 30 feet of you. Until the end of your next turn, the next time that weapon or object hits a creature, it deals an additional 1d8 radiant damage (if you are good or neutral), or 1d8 necrotic damage (if you are evil). You can use this feature while possessing a host.
This damage increases by 1d8 at 6th level, and again at 11th level and 15th level.

sheet.description: The next time a weapon or object you choose (within 30 feet) hits a creature, it deals additional {{lingering-soul-invoke-smite-die}}d8 damage (radiant if you are good or neutral, necrotic if evil). You can use this feature while possessing a host.

description.p: Beginning with this calling at 1st level, you discover how to restore vitality through divine spirit energy. As an action, target a creature within 30 feet of you to regain a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your Aspect modifier. You can use this feature while possessing a host, and if your host is not the target, your host also regains hit points equal equal to your Aspect modifier.

You can use this feature twice. Upon reaching 6th level, the healing increases by 1d8 and you can use this feature three times. At 11th level, the healing by 1d8 and you can use this feature four times. When you reach 15th level, the healing increases by 1d8 and you can use this feature five times.
You can regain all uses of this feature after a long rest.

sheet.description: Target a creature within 30 feet to regain {{lingering-soul-sympathetic-mending-die}}d8+{{lingering-soul-aspect-mod}} hit points. You can use this feature while possessing a host, and if your host is not the target, your host also regains {{lingering-soul-aspect-mod}} hit points.

description.p: At 6th level, you learn to protect your host by using your ghostly body to create a temporary shield. While you are possessing a host, if an attacker that you can see hits your host with an attack, you can use your reaction to grant your host a bonus to their AC or saving throw against the triggering attack equal to your Aspect modifier.
Once the attack is resolved, the possession immediately ends, and you cannot use your Possession feature until the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: When an attacker that you can see hits your possessed host with an attack, you can grant your host a +{{lingering-soul-aspect-mod}} bonus to their AC or saving throw against the triggering attack. After this the possession ends, and you cannot use your Possession feature until the end of your next turn.

description.p: Upon reaching 11th level, you can exude an aura that punishes those you deem unworthy. You can use an action to emit an aura around you up to a distance of 15 feet for up to 1 minute. You then designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it.

An affected creature’s speed is halved in the area, and when the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d6 radiant damage (if you are good or neutral), or 3d6 necrotic damage (if you are evil). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. You can use this feature while possessing a host.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: You emit an aura around you up to a distance of 15 feet for up to 1 minute, and designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature’s speed is halved in the area, and when it enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a DC {{lingering-soul-aspect-dc}} Wisdom saving throw, taking 3d6 damage (radiant if you are good or neutral, necrotic if evil), or half as much on a successful save. You can use this feature while possessing a host.

description.p: When you reach 15th level, you radiate protective energy that staves off the shadow of death. All friendly creatures within 30 feet of you gain 1 hit point on a death saving throw roll of 18 to 20 on the d20. This aura remains while possessing a host.

sheet.description: Friendly creatures within 30 feet of you gain 1 hit point on a death saving throw roll of 18 to 20 on the d20. This aura remains while possessing a host.

description.p: At 15th level, you can use your action to temporarily imbue your host with some of your ghostly properties. For 10 minutes, your host gains the following features:

ul.li: They have damage resistance against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.
They are immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition.
They are immune to the prone, grappled, restrained, and petrified conditions.
They can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You both take 1d10 force damage if they end their turn inside an object.
They have a fly speed equal to their speed.

description.p: The duration ends prematurely if the possession ends. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: You temporarily grant your host some of your ghostly properties: damage/conditions resistances/immunities, movement through creatures/objects, fly speed.

description.p: Your Aspect modifier is equal to your Strength modifier.

Some of your Lingering Soul features require you to make an Aspect attack, or your target to make a saving throw to resist a feature’s effects. The modifier and saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

center.p: Lingering Soul save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Aspect modifier
Aspect attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Aspect modifier

sheet.description: Your Aspect modifier is +{{lingering-soul-aspect-mod}}, your Aspect attack modifier is +{{lingering-soul-aspect-attack}}, and your Lingering Soul save DC is {{lingering-soul-aspect-dc}}.
